name: Basmati Rice and Pea Pilaf (Peas Pulao)
description: With plenty of rice on hand, a basmati rice and pea pilaf is in order. Subtle, fragrant spices coat the rice, and the peas add a wonderful sweet burst to the dish. It's a simple and straightforward side, but little green peas and a combination of chilis, onions, and warm spices make it far more exciting than any bowl of plain white rice.
recipeIngredient: 4 to 5 small green chillies, slit lengthwise
1 cup fresh or frozen green peas

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add cloves and cinnamon and cook until fragrant, about 20 seconds. Add chillies and onions and cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown, 6 to 8 minutes. Add rice and cook, stirring frequently, until nutty, about 2 minutes. Add peas and cumin powder and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute longer. Add water and salt, bring to a boil, and reduce to lowest heat setting. Cover with lid and allow to cook until all the water is absorbed, about 10 to 12 minutes. Serve hot with daal or raita.
